properties.language: The official language of China is Mandarin.
properties.population: The population of China is 1.393 billion.
properties.facts: China is the world's third biggest country by territory and has the largest population. It is one of the longest-running civilizations on earth with its unique and attractive culture. China has developed at record speed, to become the second largest economy in the world.

properties.language: The official languages are Hindi and English.
properties.population: The population of India is 1.353 billion.
properties.facts: Its government is a constitutional republic that represents a highly diverse population consisting of thousands of ethnic groups and likely hundreds of languages. India has the largest postal network in the world, with over 1,55,015 post offices.

properties.language: The official languages are Urdu and English
properties.population: The population of Pakistan is 212.2 million.
properties.facts: One of the world's earliest and largest civilizations flourished in this region. Pakistan's superior position in Asia makes it a center of trade in the region. Their largest natural deep port of the world acts as a portal for western China.

properties.population: The population of Nigeria is 195.9 million.
properties.facts: Nigeria has over 500 indigenous languages and 250 ethnic groups with a distinct culture and traditions.They are a large producer of crude oil, with an average of 2,5 million barrels a day. It plays a vital role in the Nigerian economy.

properties.population: The population of Bangladesh is 161.4 million
properties.facts: Bangladesh as a country only exists since 1971. It used to be East Pakistan until its independence. Many worldwide clothing brands source their products from Bangladesh, with an estimated 4,000 garment factories in operation. Along with this, problems of child labour and lack of work environment safety exist.

properties.population: The population of Russia is 144.5 million.
properties.facts: Russia has more billionaires than anywhere else in the world - 79, according to Forbes. It does seem that Russia is a very corrupt country, ranked 137 out of 198 on Transparency Internationalâ€™s 2019 Corruption Perception Index. Moscow and St. Petersburg are the two most important cultural and financial centres in Russia
